title.narrative: ENABLING ENVIRONMENT, M&E AND COORDINATION

description.narrative: By 2023, national capacity of financing, coordinating, planning, monitoring and evaluating the Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) sector is enhanced, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, increased proportions of the population use adequate, equitable and sustainable basic drinking water, sanitation and hygiene services in households, schools and healthcare facilities in target rural, peri-urban and humanitarian settings.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, national capacity of financing, coordinating, planning, monitoring and evaluating the WASH sector is enhanced

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to strengthen capacities of the Ministry of Hydraulics, Energy and Mining (MHEM) for sector coordination, sector monitoring and participation in international forums a such as Sanitation and Water for All (SWA). UNICEF continued to act as lead donor for WASH, organizing quarterly donor meetings with technical meetings on sanitation/hygiene and water supply in between. An important co-funding project was initiated with the African Development Bank (AfDB), which will fund 18 technical studies for water supply systems. UNICEF also launched a study on climate change risks for WASH services. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:23/12/2021
